description:
The binary dependencies required to run nova aren't really discoverable. They aren't present in bindep.txt which would be the expected mechanism for discovering them. (it's only used to install the unit test binary requirements) This makes it difficult to figure out how to install nova from source in an environment since it's not clear what non-python dependencies there are. We should either add everything into bindep.txt (or a separate bindep file not used for unit testing) or document them in the devref (ideally both) to make it easy for users and packagers to know what needs to be installed to run nova. 

I also was not able to find any documentation on the binary package requirements for nova anywhere in the docs. The only place where I found the list of packages was the devstack code, but this is hardly discoverable when trying to install nova by hand. I feel like at a minimum we should document the requirements in the devref.
title: Binary dependencies aren't easily discoverable

comments.content:
Ehhh, I don't know how I feel about documenting binary package dependencies in the nova devref as it depends on service, configuration and OS/distro.

We used to have a somewhat full list in https://docs.openstack.org/developer/nova/development.environment.html#explicit-install-clone but then we got bindep and that was cleaned up.

Plus anything in the devref is going to get out of date quickly.

I'm just not really sure this is worth the effort for something that's going to rot in the devref.
